name: Burglary offenses; intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights
text:
[§708-812.5]  Burglary offenses; intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights.  A person engages in conduct "with intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights" if the person formed the intent to commit within the building a crime against a person or property rights before, during, or after unlawful entry into the building. [L 2006, c 230, pt of §2]
 
COMMENTARY ON §708-812.5
 
  Act 230, Session Laws 2006, added this section, defining the phrase "with intent to commit therein a crime against a person or against property rights."
